text:
Doubt and Confusion

Dimly lit room, Raskolnikov and Razumihin tense.  
Raskolnikov: “Damn them! Don’t be downhearted.”  

Raskolnikov: “Must I really explain myself again?”  
Razumihin: “Stay! You were wrong. Think it through!”  

Raskolnikov: “I’ll squeeze the truth out of Porfiry!”  
Raskolnikov: “Damn it! Zametov…”  

---
Tension rises, Raskolnikov's frustration evident.  
Raskolnikov: “If I had done it, I’d admit seeing them.”  

Razumihin: “But why speak against yourself?”  
Raskolnikov: “Only novices deny everything flatly.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov grapples with the psychological intricacies of his situation and the impending cross-examination regarding the murder.
